full_bio: Dr. Faisal Mir is a distinguished graduate of Howard University College of Dentistry. He completed his residency training at the College of Physicians & Surgeons of Columbia University in New York City, New York. Dr. Mir is trained as a general dentist focusing on cosmetic, and restorative dentistry. He has extensive training in endodontic therapy (root canal treatment), and periodontal surgery (gum treatment). He is also a Certified Invisalign Preferred Provider (clear braces). Dr. Mir values the importance of high quality patient care and satisfaction. He has extensive knowledge and experience using state of the art technology and techniques to ensure his patient’s dental visit is a pleasant one. Dr. Mir is a member of the Academy of General Dentistry, American Dental Association, DC Dental Society, and Virginia Dental Association. He continues to attend educational seminars to provide his patients with the latest treatment options using evidenced-based and cutting-edge technological advances and methods. For fun, he enjoys hiking, traveling, spending time with his family and getting to know different cultures around the world.
education: Howard University College of Dentistry; College of Physicians & Surgeons of Columbia University
experience: General dentist focusing on cosmetic and restorative dentistry; extensive training in endodontic therapy (root canal treatment) and periodontal surgery (gum treatment); Certified Invisalign Preferred Provider (clear braces); member of Academy of General Dentistry, American Dental Association, DC Dental Society, and Virginia Dental Association; attends educational seminars

full_bio: Dr. Tefesehet Mesfin, the founder of 202 Dental Care, believes in providing a truly relaxing dental services focused on excellence and patient comfort. It’s her aim to make you feel so relaxed it feels like sipping coffee with an old friend. Dr. Mesfin has been practicing dentistry in Washington, D.C. for the last six years serving patients living and working in the Washington Metropolitan region. A two-time Ivy league graduate, Dr. Mesfin graduated from University of Pennsylvania in Biomedical Engineering. She then earned her Doctor of Dental Surgery from the Columbia University in New York City. Philippines Dental mission trip She continued her studies by completing a post-doctoral residency in general dentistry at Bronx-Lebanon Hospital in NYC. While working at the Hospital she focused her time on root canal treatments, oral surgery, bridges, and crowns. Dr. Mesfin is a strong believer in continuing education; she continually fortifies and develops her dentistry skills by completing extensive continuing education programs each year. She wants to stay on top of the latest leading-edge dental developments to offer patients complete, individualized dental care including cosmetic, restorative and surgical services. Dr. Mesfin is proud to be a member of the American Dental Association. When not providing top-quality dental care to her valued patients or working pro bono to make a difference, Dr. Mesfin's multicultural interests extend to travel, photography, spinning, and spending time with family and friends. Dr. Mesfin's vision of a dentistry based on kindness and comfort is underlined by her pro bono work locally and internationally in Ethiopia, Cambodia, Guatemala, and the Philippines. Her goal is to provide the less fortunate around the world with the dental care that they deserve - because everyone smiles in the same language!
education: University of Pennsylvania (Biomedical Engineering); Doctor of Dental Surgery, Columbia University; Post-doctoral residency in General Dentistry, Bronx-Lebanon Hospital
experience: Practicing dentistry in Washington, D.C. for six years; root canal treatments, oral surgery, bridges, crowns; pro bono dental mission trips in Ethiopia, Cambodia, Guatemala, Philippines

full_bio: Dr. Thaddeus Harvey Jr. was born in Macon, Georgia and raised in Roberta, GA . A product of the local public school system, Dr. Harvey was faced with limited resources. With help from dedicated faculty and staff, he made the best of his situation and thrived in primary school . In his spare time, he managed to letter in sports and participate in many volunteer events around his community. While in high school, he was given the opportunity to participate in the Pipeline Prehealth program at Fort Valley State University. This pre-med program would prove to be the building blocks of his career in healthcare. Upon graduation from High school with honors, Dr. Harvey matriculated to Fort Valley State University. While in college, Dr. Harvey remained active in the Pipeline Prehealth program. He also shadowed several healthcare providers and found an affinity to the field of dentistry. Dr. Harvey began Dental School at Howard University in the Fall of 2003 and graduated with honors in 2007. Upon graduation, he attended a general practice residency at Jackson Memorial Hospital in Miami, Florida. Today he practices dentistry in Atlanta, GA and finds most enjoyment in dental implantology. When away from work, he enjoys spending time with his lovely wife Candace and children, Zoe (5) and Carter (3).
education: Fort Valley State University; Howard University (Dental School, 2003-2007); General Practice Residency at Jackson Memorial Hospital, Miami, Florida
experience: Practicing dentistry in Atlanta, GA; focus on dental implantology

full_bio: Dr. Candace Harvey was raised in the small, rural town of St. Matthews, South Carolina. She graduated from South Carolina State University, in Orangeburg, South Carolina, with a Bachelors of Science degree in Biology. Shortly afterwards, Dr. Harvey was accepted into Howard University College of Dentistry, in Washington, DC, where she obtained her Doctorate of Dental Surgery degree in May 2007. She then completed a one-year general practice residency at Saint Francis Hospital and Medical Center in Hartford, Connecticut. Dr. Harvey moved to the Atlanta metro area in 2009. After working with both adults and children, Dr. Harvey realized that her true passion was working with children. Although she is a General Dentist, Dr. Harvey has decided to devote her primary focus towards Pediatric Dentistry. Dr. Harvey is married and has two beautiful children. She enjoys traveling, reading and partaking in any outdoor sport or activity, but most important, she enjoys spending quality time with her husband, Thaddeus and their beautiful children, Zoe and Carter.
education: South Carolina State University (B.S. Biology); Howard University College of Dentistry (DDS, May 2007); General Practice Residency at Saint Francis Hospital and Medical Center, Hartford, Connecticut
experience: Practicing in Atlanta metro area since 2009; focus on Pediatric Dentistry

full_bio: Dr. Young's experience, training, and new technology will give you and your loved ones a brighter, healthier smile. As a family and implant dentist, Dr. Michael J. Young provides exceptional, compassionate care. With an office in Lafayette, Dr. Young performs a full range of dental services, from routine preventive cleanings to advanced restorative and cosmetic procedures. In every case, our team places great importance on patient comfort and convenience. That is why we proudly offer sedation options, convenient financing, and back-to-back appointments for family members. Dr. Young is also committed to ongoing education to bring you the latest treatment options. As a member of both the Academy of General Dentistry and the American Academy of Cosmetic Dentistry, he has undertaken rigorous training in contemporary procedures, such as dental implant placement and same‑day crowns. Michael J. Young, DDS began his collegiate career at Louisiana State University at Eunice, where he studied basic science and nursing. He then moved on to Louisiana State University at Baton Rouge to pursue a biochemistry degree with the intent of applying to dental school. Dr. Young began his dental education at Louisiana State University (LSU) School of Dentistry in 1999 and graduated in 2003. He worked as an associate dentist and completed many hours of continuing education, including training in dental implants and cosmetic dentistry. After two years as an associate dentist, Dr. Young opened his own dental practice in 2005. Dr. Young completed dental implant training at Misch Resnik Implant Institute in California, in 2016‑17. He has also completed the Progressive Orthodontic Seminars Program, a part of the McGann Postgraduate School of Dentistry.

experience: Associate dentist for two years after graduation; opened own dental practice in 2005; provides family and implant dentistry services in Lafayette; ongoing continuing education; member of Academy of General Dentistry and American Academy of Cosmetic Dentistry; extensive experience in preventive, restorative, cosmetic, orthodontic, and implant dentistry.

full_bio: Dr. Chong was born and raised in Toronto, Canada, where he studied at the University of Toronto obtaining his degree in Industrial Engineering and Applied Mathematics. Thereafter, he went on to complete his dental education at New York University where he graduated amongst the top of his class and was inducted into the Omicron Kappa Upsilon National Dental Honor Society. It is needless to say but his passion to educate has given him the opportunity to present case studies at conferences, lead study clubs, and train at world class dental institutions. Dr. Chong completed his orthodontic residency at the University of Illinois in Chicago while excelling at the top of his class with accolades such as winner of a National Invisalign Award. During his tenure at UIC he also obtained a Masters degree for his research involving the development of a novel method for analysis of tooth movement in 3D. Dr. Chong is a caring and talented dentist who possesses the highest qualifications and is well skilled in all aspects of orthodontics. He is an adept practitioner committed to providing the best care available personalized for each family member.

full_bio: Board Certified Periodontist Dr. Mohammed Al Rubaie, DMD. full_bio: Born and raised in Tampa, Dr. Abdoney, also know as Mark is a third-generation dentist , having followed his grandfather, father, and mother into the field. He is dedicated to providing specialty periodontal care with an emphasis on personal attention, compassion, and excellent results. Dr. Abdoney is a graduate of the University of Florida , where he received a Bachelor of Science in 1992 and his Doctorate of Dental Medicine in 1996. He completed his periodontal residency at Nova Southeastern University in 2000. That same year, he received the Award of Periodontal Excellence from the NSU Department of Periodontics. Since graduating, Dr. Abdoney has been actively involved in the field of dentistry. He has served as president of the Florida Association of Periodontists and the Hillsborough County Dental Research Clinic, and has been on the board of the Hillsborough County Periodontal Association, the Florida Association of Periodontists, and the Southern Academy of Periodontology. He is an active member of the prestigious American College of Dentistry , the International College of Dentistry , and the Spear Institute . Along with these organizations, Dr. Abdoney has maintained a close association with the University of Florida as a current Associate Clinical Professor and works frequently with their Department of Pathology regarding a majority of patient biopsies. He is also a member of the Rotary Club, consistent with his hope of improving the health and education of not only his own patients but the community at large. Outside of his practice, Dr. Abdoney enjoys spending time with his four beautiful daughters and extended family. Growing up as a Boy Scout and in the outdoors in general, he is an avid outdoorsman. He loves to fish, dive, hunt, camp, hike, and surf. Earning a degree in zoology from the University of Florida, Dr. Abdoney takes particular interest in the many habitats and ecosystems the great state of Florida has to offer, as well as land management, animal husbandry, and agriculture. He also enjoys training in MMA and jiu-jitsu.
education: University of Florida – Bachelor of Science (1992), Doctorate of Dental Medicine (1996); Nova Southeastern University – Periodontal Residency (2000)
experience: President of Florida Association of Periodontists; President of Hillsborough County Dental Research Clinic; Board member of Hillsborough County Periodontal Association, Florida Association of Periodontists, Southern Academy of Periodontology; Member of American College of Dentistry, International College of Dentistry, Spear Institute; Associate Clinical Professor at University of Florida; Member of Rotary Club; Active involvement in dentistry since 1996

full_bio: Dr. Wiesner is the founder and CEO of A Brighter Smile Dental Care. He has more than 4,000 personal patients that come from 11 different states, some of which include Virginia, North Dakota, and Minnesota. His practice has received the Top Dentist Award from the prestigious Locals Love Us brand four years in a row. Dr. Wiesner donates many hours to local community events and has appeared on KTBS, KSLA, and Fox News. Among the charity events, he has hosted are Dentistry from the Heart, a day that offers free dental care to the community, and Free from Plaque for Veterans. The Free From Plaque Campaign, which offers free cleanings to veterans on Veteran’s Day, is a personal cause of Dr. Wiesner’s since he himself is a veteran of the United States Armed Forces: He has been stationed in Little Rock, Arkansas, and even England. He graduated from Louisiana State University of Shreveport with a degree in biochemistry and furthered his education at Louisiana State University’s School of Dentistry where he received his Doctorate of Dental Surgery. Post-graduation, Dr. Wiesner continues to enhance his dental portfolio by taking extra courses in dental implantology and IV sedation (a method that allows patients to receive extensive dental work while being in a complete state of relaxation or asleep .) Dr. Wiesner maintains an active membership with the American Dental Implant Association and the American Academy of Facial Esthetics . Collectively, he and his team have more than 75 years of experience in the dental field.
education: Louisiana State University of Shreveport – degree in biochemistry; Louisiana State University School of Dentistry – Doctorate of Dental Surgery; additional courses in dental implantology and IV sedation
experience: More than 75 years of combined experience with his team; founder and CEO of A Brighter Smile Dental Care; extensive community involvement and charitable work

full_bio: Dr. Thuy, General Family Dentist, is the co-founder and co-CEO of A Brighter Smile Dental Care. A Brighter Smile Dental Care has seen more than 11,000 patients since Dr. Thuy helped establish it in 2007. The practice has been featured in the Shreveport Times , and patients have come from as far as California, Utah, and Illinois to have work performed by Dr. Thuy. Her role in the practice’s orthodontic care won her Premier Provider for Invisalign® status in 2016. Dr. Thuy is an active contributor to local charities. Some of the charity campaigns she has been an instrumental part of are: the Shreveport Holy Angels Run for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities, Pay it Forward, and St. Jude’s Fight Against Childhood Cancer. She is an advocate for helping underprivileged children, and collects toys at A Brighter Smile Dental Care every holiday season for the local homeless shelter’s children. Dr. Thuy graduated from the University of New Orleans with her degree in biological sciences, as well as Louisiana State University’s School of Dentistry with her Doctorate of Dental Surgery. She is a member of the International Association for Orthodontics. Her desire to provide the highest quality of care for her patients is evident in her ongoing education and completion of additional education courses in sleep apnea and orthodontics. Dr. Thuy is certified by the American Academy of Facial Esthetics . Dr. Wiesner and Dr. Thuy are happily married with two beautiful children. Together, they work side by side to provide excellent dental care to their patients in the Shreveport-Bossier area.

full_bio: Dr. Milstead was born and raised in Shreveport. She completed her high school education at Caddo Magnet High School where she graduated with honors and proceeded to Louisiana State University Shreveport to work on her degree in biological sciences. With hard work, dedication, and a passion to pursue a career in dentist ry, she received early acceptance into dental school at Louisiana State University School of Dentistry in New Orleans where she received her Doctorate of Dental Surgery. Following graduation, she practiced in the New Orleans area for four years before returning to Shreveport to be closer to family and continue to care for patients in her hometown. Dr. Milstead has experience in treating patients of all ages, including children, and she is dedicated to providing them with high-quality dental care. She believes in giving them the most comfortable and gentle dental experience possible, and she feels that trust, comfort, communication, and compassion are the keys to a great doctor-patient relationship. Dr. Milstead has received several awards in prosthodontics and operative dentistry as well as the International College of Dentists Leadership Award. She has volunteered with Give Kids a Smile, participated in providing care on free treatment days in the Shreveport community, and traveled with a local church to provide free dental services in Mexico. She is currently a member of the American Dental Association , the Louisiana Dental Association , and the Northwest Louisiana Dental Association. When she’s not in the office, Dr. Milstead enjoys spending time with her eight horses, three dogs, and six cats. Dr. Milstead also loves traveling and attending LSU football games. Dr. Dr. Milstead is excited to be a part of A Brighter Smile Dental Care and looks forward to helping you take care of your smile!

experience: Practiced in New Orleans for four years; extensive experience treating patients of all ages; multiple awards in prosthodontics and operative dentistry; volunteer work with Give Kids a Smile and free treatment days; member of ADA, LDA, NLDA

full_bio: Dr. Hernandez was born in Havana, Cuba, and emigrated to Canada at age 12. Five years later she emigrated again to Miami, Florida where she finished High School. Given her international upbringing, she is also fluent in Spanish and French. Dr. Hernandez attended Florida International University and graduated with Honors with a Bachelor of Biological Sciences degree and a minor in Psychology. Her empathetic nature made her gravitate toward the medical field from an early age and decided to become a dentist where she could use her knowledge, skills, and training to help others improve their health and quality of life. Dr. Hernandez attended the University of Florida College of Dentistry where she obtained her Doctorate in Dental Medicine. Her artistic skills and passion for teaching other dental students led her to be a teacher assistant for Aesthetic Dentistry and Prosthodontics courses. She was also the president of the Hispanic Student Dental Association and coordinated an extracurricular clinic for underserved communities and migrant workers while in dental school. Upon graduation, Dr. Hernandez was awarded an American Prosthodontic Society Student Award of Merit and the American Association of Endodontics Student Award of Merit. Dr. Hernandez’s passion for uplifting and inspiring her patients to achieve a harmonious healthy smile is what drives her professional interests, which are centered on restorative sciences and include the fields of endodontics, prosthodontics, oral surgery, and implantology. Dr. Hernandez enjoys spending time with her Siberian Husky Piper, drawing, weight-lifting, and loves to read all kinds of books especially those recommended by her patients.

full_bio: Dr. Thomas grew up in Mesa, AZ where her family still currently resides running a Pediatric Pulmonary clinic and a horse ranch. After graduating from Desert Ridge High School in Mesa, AZ, Dr. Thomas attended Arizona State University to receive a bachelor’s degree in Biological Sciences with a minor in Dance. She furthered her education at the University of Colorado School of Dental Medicine and served in the United States Army for 4 years. After the military brought her family to Shreveport-Bossier, Dr. Thomas settled into practice with A Brighter Smile. Dr. Thomas has experience with patients who suffer from dental anxiety and strives to make all her patients as comfortable as possible in the dental chair. She puts great effort into building a personal connection with all her patients to ensure comfort, trust, and the best dental experience possible. Dr. Thomas specializes in CEREC dentistry, providing same-day permanent crowns to her community. She is also a member of the American Dental Association , Colorado Dental Association, and the American Academy of Facial Esthetics . Her continuing education includes further training in Endodontics, pediatrics, and cosmetic dentistry. In her spare time, Dr. Thomas loves to spend time with her family, be outdoors, and participate in events with her children. Dr. Thomas also loves training for physical fitness to include long-distance running, biking, weightlifting, and hiking. She is also an avid horseback rider, country music lover, and coffee drinker.

full_bio: Dr. Ricky Fox was born and raised in Shreveport, LA and practices in our Shreveport Suite 500 office. After graduating from Captain Shreve High School, Dr. Fox received his degree in medical sciences from Louisiana State University Shreveport. With a passion to follow in the footsteps of his father as a 4th generation medical/dental professional, Dr. Fox attended Louisiana State University School of Dentistry in New Orleans where he received his Doctorate of Dental Surgery. After graduation, Dr. Fox practiced in Chalmette, LA for two years before returning to Northwest Louisiana. He practiced at his own office, Bossier Dental Health Center, in Bossier City for seven years before moving back across the river to his hometown neighborhoods. In Shreveport, he continued his family's legacy and continued his late father's practice at Fox Family Dentistry, which was started the year Dr. Ricky Fox was born almost sixty years ago. Dr. Ricky is experienced in orthodontics, cosmetic dentistry, and sleep apnea treatment. He is a member of the Community of 100 at LSU School of Dentistry - giving back to his alma mater and supporting the education of future dentists. With thirty-two years of experience in general and family dentistry, Dr. Ricky is committed to providing excellent care while developing lasting patient-doctor relationships and lifelong friendships. In his free time, Dr. Ricky enjoys playing golf and tennis, hunting and fishing, and spending time with his lovely wife, family, and their 6 grandchildren. Dr. Ricky joined A Brighter Smile in late 2022 to enjoy the community of our team, work closely with other dentists, and be a part of a growing professional practice. He is excited to share his plethora of knowledge gained from his thirty-two years of experience. Dr. Ricky is grateful for the daily opportunity to provide care to patients today that his father once treated as children and having the role as the family dentist to 4th generation patients of his family's practice.
education: Louisiana State University Shreveport – degree in medical sciences; Louisiana State University School of Dentistry (New Orleans) – Doctorate of Dental Surgery

full_bio: Dr. Christopher Marsalis was born and raised in Shreveport, Louisiana, only leaving the area to attend dental school. A graduate of Loyola College Prep, he went on to earn a Bachelor of Arts in Biology from Centenary College in 2016. He also completed additional coursework in the sciences at Louisiana State University in Shreveport before earning his Doctorate of Dental Surgery from LSU School of Dentistry in New Orleans. Before dental school, Dr. Marsalis took part in a rewarding volunteer opportunity through the Literacy Volunteers program at Centenary College, where he taught English as a second or third language to a small group of adult learners. Dr. Marsalis is proud to join the experienced team at A Brighter Smile Dental Care and is committed to providing exceptional care to every patient he serves.

full_bio: As a native Las Vegan, I came to the San Francisco Bay Area to pursue my dream of becoming a dentist. In 1990, I graduated from The University of the Pacific School of Dentistry with High Honors. I continued in an Advanced Education in General Dentistry program for an additional two years. I have forever been an avid learner and continued to be so as I established my practice with the idea that people must be treated honestly and humanely. In addition to the traditional continuing education requirements needed to maintain my dental license, I also returned to school after a number of years in order to obtain my board certification in Naturopathic Medicine. I believe teeth are very important, but the old adage "only floss the ones you want to keep" falls way short of the mark. It's not just what the gums are doing in your mouth, but also what that bacteria is doing to the rest of your body. Whole body wellness is a big emphasis that I have and I work with other local practitioners to accomplish this approach. In addition to a busy practice, I juggle being a wife and mother of three and all around Type-A personality.
education: University of the Pacific School of Dentistry (graduated 1990, High Honors); Advanced Education in General Dentistry (2 years); Board certification in Naturopathic Medicine.

full_bio: Being a dentist is who I am and what I do. Each day I think of how I can improve the quality of my work, in order to provide patients with the advanced, quality dentistry they deserve. As a dentist, it is a pleasure to care for down-to-earth individuals and to share in their lives through the years. I appreciate that we can trade jokes, talk about mountain bike trails, or celebrate a new a member of their family, all while in a dental office. One of the most rewarding aspects of my career is having the ability to positively impact people’s lives. Whether relieving pain, offering practical education, addressing sleep disorders, or promoting overall health, with each interaction I can help people. I especially love restorative work and seeing people leave the office with new smiles, smiles they love and that will boost their confidence in life! ~ Dr. Koalby Brown Education and Continuing Education Dr. Brown grew up in Ogden, Utah. He attended Utah State University, where he obtained his Bachelor of Science. His Doctorate of Dental Medicine was awarded by Midwestern University in Phoenix, Arizona. Following dental school, Dr. Brown practiced in Phoenix until relocating to Grangeville, Idaho, in 2018. Dental school provided Dr. Brown with a solid foundational understanding of the science, medicine, and artistry of dentistry. However, the field – like all areas of healthcare – is constantly advancing. Ongoing research leads to new techniques, materials, and technologies, all of which may improve patient care, the dental experience, and results. Through active continuing education, Dr. Brown stays at the forefront of the latest developments. In addition to studying changes in general dentistry, he has sought out specialized training that allows him to better serve his patients’ needs. Dr. Brown has studied implant dentistry, as well as the use of dental lasers. Additionally, he has completed advanced training in sleep apnea, knowing that treating apnea helps preserve teeth while also allowing individuals to live longer and healthier lives. Beyond the Office Dr. Brown resides in McCall, Idaho, with his wife, Haley, and their dog, Rockwell. In addition to prioritizing time with loved ones, Dr. Brown loves exploring the outdoors. He can often be found on a mountain bike trail – or a pair of skis.
education: Bachelor of Science, Utah State University; Doctorate of Dental Medicine, Midwestern University in Phoenix, Arizona
experience: Practiced in Phoenix until relocating to Grangeville, Idaho, in 2018; additional specialized training in implant dentistry, dental lasers, and sleep apnea.

full_bio: Dr. Mohamed Elnazer graduated in 2013 with high honors from Boston University-Henry M. Goldman School of Dental Medicine, where he was on the Dean's List. Eager to become the best dentist he could be, Dr. Elnazer immediately pursued his Advanced Education in General Dentistry (AEGD) Residency at the University of Texas Health Science Center San Antonio and successfully completed it as one of the most hard-working graduates of the program. After finishing his residency, he returned to Massachusetts where he worked in high-quality private practice settings until the summer of 2018. He then moved to Connecticut with his wife to enable her to pursue her residency at Yale Neurology. Dr. Elnazer started working at Advanced Dentistry of Connecticut in the summer of 2018 and purchased the practice in early 2021. Equipped with years of experience and mastery of dental skills, he provides his patients with high-quality, multidisciplinary, comprehensive dentistry in a family-oriented way. Patients and staff of Dr. Elnazer describe him as compassionate, knowledgeable, honest, and thorough. He works with an incredible staff who are sensitive to their patients' needs and have been serving their community for years with a smile and warm hearts. Dr. Elnazer believes that constantly evolving as a dentist through continuing education courses is essential to providing the best dental treatments available to his patients. He used to travel every week to attend aesthetics and full mouth rehabilitation courses at the prestigious Linhart Educational Center at NYU. He has also finished a residency in adult dental sleep medicine to treat patients with obstructive sleep apnea through oral appliances at Tufts Dental School and received Diplomate status from the American Board of Dental Sleep Medicine. The journey never stops. Outside of dentistry, Dr. Elnazer is an avid runner, completing the Baystate Marathon in Lowell, MA, and other Boston Area Half Marathons. He enjoys hiking, watching soccer, traveling, and spending time with his wife and kids.

full_bio: Note from Dr. Allen Job: Providing dentistry for children requires a calling. As a profession, it requires having a strong clinical skill set, a keen understanding of medical conditions, knowledge and application of child psychology, and most importantly, compassion and patience. I have always enjoyed working with children and adolescents, and love being able to help them with their oral health needs. Each day, as I meet with new patients and their parents, I challenge myself to make a positive impact during their visit. Many parents come burdened with fear, from their own past experiences, wishing their child will not have to go through the same. I am reminded daily of the responsibility parents place in my hands, to treat their children with the utmost care and respect. I listen to my patients’ concerns and strive to provide a caring, safe environment in which to have their treatment. It is through each encounter, one patient at a time, that we are able to make a difference in the lives of those we are honored to serve. I provide lip and tongue tie treatment using a soft tissue laser. I have been trained and certified to use the dental laser since 2002. Click here to read more about this procedure and how it may assist your child.

full_bio: Orthodontist Improving Lives with Beautiful Smiles My patients are like a second family to me. Each is unique and brings his or her own personality to the office. I enjoy getting to know patients personally while helping them achieve a beautifully healthy smile — one they’ll love for a lifetime! Our smiles are how we greet the world. When people have crooked teeth, they often feel self-conscious and uncomfortable at school and work. Patients start orthodontics with low self-esteem and a reluctance to engage with their peers. As they see their teeth start to move into proper position, these people begin to feel better about themselves. They make eye contact and walk taller. Best of all, they start to talk happily and laugh with others, and to share their smile. By the time they finish, each is a new person: smiling with confident ease! I am passionate about the lasting difference orthodontic care makes. Although many think of braces as being all about smiles, the reality is that properly positioned teeth improve oral health and make it easier to keep your teeth and gums healthy and clean. Orthodontics also means better function and less strain on the jaw, which lessens the likelihood of TMJ-TMD in the future. My profession enables me to improve lives by helping people I care about to achieve beautiful smiles. I can’t imagine anything more rewarding! Education and Continuing Education Bachelor of Science in biochemistry – University of California, Berkeley Doctorate of Dental Surgery – Columbia University Certificate in orthodontics – Columbia University Each year, I complete many hours of continuing education here in Hawaii and abroad. Orthodontics is constantly evolving, and I want to use the best technologies and techniques available. These make the orthodontic experience as effective and comfortable as possible for my patients. I’ve been an Elite Preferred Provider for Invisalign® treatment (reserved for the top 1% of providers nationwide) since 2008 and am a Pacific Northwest Regional Leader. I am one of only a handful of women in the world to have earned this title. I have successfully treated more than 1,000 patients with Invisalign and can accomplish outstanding results! Professional Memberships Hawaii Society of Orthodontists Pacific Coast Society of Orthodontists American Association of Orthodontists American Dental Association Hawaii Dental Association California Dental Association Beyond the Office After growing up in Korea, I call Honolulu my home. My husband is Dr. Michon Morita and I’m Mom to two beautiful children. Being with my family is important to me, and I enjoy playing the piano. Say Aloha!

full_bio: Nassim F. Olabi, DDS, MSD Dr. Olabi was born in Cameroon, Africa, raised in the country of Lebanon, then moved to the United States at the age of 13. He graduated from Iowa’s Dowling High School then received a Bachelors Degree in business and soccer scholarship from Grand View College in Des Moines. After graduation he relocated to Cleveland, Ohio to play professional soccer for the next 8 years in the National Professional Soccer League and the Continental Indoor Soccer League. Dr. Olabi was inducted into the Soccer Hall of Fame at Grandview University. Also, he worked as a soccer coach for children ages 5-14. After retiring from soccer, Dr. Olabi moved to Indianapolis and obtained his Doctor of Dental Surgery Degree from the Indiana University School of Dentistry and completed a General Practice Residency at Wishard Memorial Hospital. His passion for helping children inspired him to continue his studies at Riley Hospital for Children where he received his Certificate in Pediatric Dentistry and his Masters Degree in Pediatric Dentistry. Dr. Olabi is also a graduate of Progressive Orthodontic Seminars and is currently enrolled in pediatric orthodontic courses through Gerber Orthodontics. Currently, Dr. Olabi serves as an adjunct faculty and assistant clinical professor in the Pediatric Dentistry Department at the Indiana University School of Dentistry. He is an active member of the American Academy of Pediatric Dentistry, the American Dental Association, the Indiana Dental Association and the Chicago Dental Society. Dr. Olabi speaks multiple languages including Spanish, French, and Arabic.

full_bio: Dr. Hunter attended UC Berkeley, where she received a BA in Genetics. She received her DDS degree from Case Western Reserve University in Cleveland, Ohio. Upon her return to the Bay Area, she taught DAU on the clinic floor at UCSF Dental School, before settling into her private practice in Livermore, and motherhood. At first, she practiced dentistry in Livermore on a part time basis, in order to raise her sons. During their childhood, she was active volunteering for the local pre-schools and elementary schools, Little League, and Cub Scouts. Professionally, she has also volunteered for Expanding Your Horizons, and LCDC. She has always pursued continuing education classes avidly. From 1994 to 1996 she attended the UCSF Miniresidency in Orofacial Pain. In 1996, having passed the board exams of the American Board of Orofacial Pain, she became a Diplomate of the American Board of Orofacial Pain. She then went on to serve on the exam committee for that organization, helping to write questions for future board exams. She continues to attend both high level general dentistry classes and orofacial pain meetings throughout the country. Now that her sons are grown, she has turned her full attention to providing high quality dental care and the treatment of orofacial pain to the Livermore community. In her new, state-of-the-art facility she is able to practice full time, including Saturday hours. full_bio: As an orthodontist, I am most passionate about working with people of all ages, from all walks of life. I enjoy meeting new people and hearing about their lives and experiences. Everyone has stories to tell, and I appreciate what my patients share with me. Our conversations enrich my life. I am thankful for the joy patients bring to me and hope I give them the same. I have practiced orthodontics for over 30 years. My father was a general dentist and I went to work in his office when I was in 6 th grade. I enjoyed it so much that I decided I wanted to become a dentist. Then I had my braces put on and thought, "This is even better!" I went through a lot of changes during my orthodontic experience. I grew as a person, my personality developed, and my self-esteem blossomed. I knew that my appearance changed, and that strengthened my confidence. By the time my braces were removed, I had a smile I really loved, and couldn’t wait to share it with the world! Now I help people as they go through the same transformation. Being part of that and seeing people’s happiness with their new smiles makes this the most amazing profession!
education: Bachelor of Science in biology – University of California at Irvine; Doctorate of Dental Medicine – University of Pittsburgh School of Dental Medicine; Master of Dental Science – University of Pittsburgh School of Dental Medicine
experience: over 30 years
